title: Creating an Inequality
text: First, we must transfer the word problem into an inequality that represents the total cost of classes.

title: Creating an Inequality
text: We know that the maximum cost Marcela can afford is $1,365, and each unit costs $105. If we let $$x$$ represent the number of units Marcela takes, then the total cost would be $$105x$$. Therefore, we have the inequality $$105x \leq 1365$$.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: Now, we must solve the inequality for $$x$$ by algebrically manipulating it.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To do this, we can divide both sides by $$105$$ to isolate $$x$$. We now have $$x \leq 13$$ as our inequality.

title: Creating a Sentence-Answer
text: Since $$x$$ must be less than or equal to $$13$$, what is the maximum number of units Marcela can take?
